NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis l4, Minnesota
April 2, 1957
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Station WILL-AM-FM-TV
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Franks
Again I am indebted to you for your help and hospitality. And again I was
impressed with your lovely family—from Frank down to Jean Brown. Thank you
(and Eleanor) for everything. Coming down now to more mundane matters:
(1) I appreciate immensely the trouble you, Harry and Harold took with
Marguerite on Friday morning. The convention outline should facilitate working
up the St, Louis meeting, although I guess that headquarters (with whatever help
you can provide too) will have to do a good deal of the work. I stand ready to
help if required, although too many cooks are apt to spoil the broth here as
otherwise, so I’ll not get into the act unless Harry — (or Marguerite too, of
course) — or whoever else he wants to bear the major brunt of this, asks me.
(2) I’m not quite clear on the television management seminar. Should we
go ahead without an okay from Ford to spend the funds that way, or wait for you
to clear it with them?
(3) I misplaced a thin, black barrel, Waterman ball point pen somewhere in
Champaign. If you find it lying around, would you mail it to me?
Good luck in your talks with the Ford folks. VJe all await the outcome.
Yours sincerely,
Burton Paulu,
President
BP sit
CCs Harry J. Skornia
